title: Southern Pecan Pie II
description: This classic Southern pecan pie is a timeless dessert that combines a buttery, flaky crust with a rich, gooey filling studded with crunchy pecan halves. Perfectly golden and beautifully presented, it’s a showstopper for holidays, special occasions, or cozy family gatherings.
ingredients: ½ cup butter, chilled and diced
instructions: In a large bowl, combine 1 ½ cups flour, 3 tablespoons sugar, and salt.
Cut in chilled butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Mix egg yolk with ice water and stir into flour mixture until dough forms a ball.
Wrap dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight.
Roll out chilled dough and place into a 9-inch pie plate.
Place pecan halves evenly in the bottom of the pie crust.
In a large bowl, stir together ¾ cup sugar and 2 tablespoons flour.
Add eggs, corn syrup, milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract; blend well.
Pour filling mixture over pecans in the crust.
Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes.
Reduce oven temperature to 350°F (175°C) and bake for an additional 40 to 50 minutes, or until golden brown and filling is set.
Allow pie to cool completely before serving to let filling firm up.
tips: Use chilled butter and ice water to ensure a flaky crust. Avoid overmixing the dough to keep it tender. Watch the pie closely during the last 10 minutes of baking to prevent burning. Let the pie cool fully to achieve the perfect sliceable texture.

structured_content.content: Southern Pecan Pie II is a beloved classic that captures the essence of Southern hospitality with its rich, buttery crust and luscious pecan filling. The aroma of toasted pecans and vanilla fills your kitchen as the pie bakes to a golden perfection, promising a delightful treat that’s both comforting and elegant.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 2 hours prep and bake time
  • Restaurant-quality flavors at home with a perfectly flaky crust
  • Perfect for holidays, family gatherings, and special celebrations
  • Uses simple pantry staples and fresh pecans for authentic taste
  • A visually stunning pie that impresses guests and delights the palate

structured_content.content: I first tasted this pie at a family reunion, where it was passed down from an elderly Southern lady through my friend Joyce. Every bite reminded me of warm Southern kitchens and the joy of sharing homemade desserts with loved ones.

• Main ingredient: Fresh pecan halves provide a crunchy texture and rich nutty flavor essential to this pie’s character. Toast lightly if desired to enhance aroma.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Vanilla extract adds warmth and depth, while light corn syrup creates the signature gooey filling.
  • Supporting ingredients: Butter ensures a flaky crust and richness in the filling; eggs bind the filling together for a smooth consistency.
  • Equipment needed: Mixing bowls, pastry cutter or fork, rolling pin, 9-inch pie plate, oven, and plastic wrap for chilling dough.

Preparation:
Combine dry ingredients and cut in chilled butter until crumbly. Add egg yolk and ice water to form dough. Chill dough for at least 1 hour to relax gluten and firm up butter.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Roll out dough and fit into pie plate. Layer pecans evenly. Mix filling ingredients thoroughly and pour over pecans. Bake at high heat initially to set crust, then reduce temperature to cook filling evenly until golden and set.
Finishing Touches:
Cool completely to allow filling to firm up for clean slices. Serve with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream for extra indulgence.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Start baking at 450°F to set the crust quickly and prevent sogginess.
  • Avoid overbaking to prevent burnt edges and dry filling.
  • Filling is ready when it’s golden brown and slightly jiggly but not liquid.
  • Store leftovers covered at room temperature for up to 2 days or refrigerate for up to 4 days; reheat gently if desired.

structured_content.content: Sharing this pie with family always brings back fond memories of Southern hospitality and festive gatherings. It’s a dessert that invites stories, laughter, and the simple joy of homemade goodness.

Enhance the pie by adding a pinch of cinnamon or nutmeg to the filling for warm spice notes. Swap light corn syrup with dark for a deeper molasses flavor. Toast pecans beforehand to intensify their nuttiness and aroma.

Serve warm or at room temperature with a dollop of freshly whipped cream or a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Pair with a cup of strong coffee or sweet tea for a classic Southern experience. Ideal for holiday dinners, potlucks, or afternoon tea.

For gluten-free crust, substitute all-purpose flour with a gluten-free blend. Vegan versions can use coconut oil in place of butter and flax eggs instead of chicken eggs. Add chocolate chips or bourbon for a decadent twist while keeping the traditional spirit.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Use chilled butter and minimal handling for a flaky crust.
  • Mix filling ingredients just until combined to avoid bubbles and cracks.
  • Start baking at high heat to set crust, then lower to finish cooking filling evenly.
  • Brush crust edges with egg wash for a glossy, golden finish.

structured_content.content: With this Southern Pecan Pie recipe, you’re not just baking a dessert—you’re creating a warm, inviting experience that fills your home with irresistible aromas and your heart with pride. Enjoy every slice and the smiles it brings!
